name: Marco LaGuardia Hotel by Lexington

reviews.text: This was a very nice find in Flushing and I agree with my fellow Trip Advisor travelers - this is the best hotel in Flushing!
reviews.title: Best Hotel in Flushing

reviews.text: Very courteous and professional staff. Room was decent sized room with iron & ironing board, mini-fridge and mini microwave. I didn't use either fridge or microwave, but it was a nicety that I could see myself using if I had stayed longer. The 2 complimentary bottles of water is appreciated after getting back to the room from meetings/trip. The complimentary wi-fi is reliable and fast unlike some other hotels.
reviews.title: The world's loudest toilets (real-time review)

reviews.text: The toilets have powerful (and loud) flushes and the shower head is awesome. The bathroom lighting could have been brighter and have warmer light instead of the cold fluorescent light. Bed, bedding and towels are top notch quality.
reviews.title: As good as last stay

reviews.text: Location is excellent and is just a few blocks to the #7 train that goes directly to Times Square, Grand Central, etc.
reviews.title: Outstanding service

reviews.text: Tip: book directly with the hotel and you'll get complimentary breakfast (~$11 if buying breakfast separately).
reviews.title: Very Nice!

reviews.text: Stayed here for 2 nights on business travel last week. The place was clean and the staff were very friendly. Received free, buffet breakfast by booking directly with them, which was a bonus. Steps to Main Street, Flushing and the 7 Train makes it very well located - free shuttle from airport also a bonus. Will likely use it as my go-to hotel for Queens business trips.
reviews.title: Fantastic Place

reviews.text: I was in town attending Travel workshops with fellow Travel Agents at the Sheraton in July. Our plans were to stay at the Sheraton, but late registration also meant no vacancies. We decided on the Marco Hotel, since it was close to our meetings. What a find! We were greeted by a friendly staff, and after we settled into our room, decided to venture out for dinner. Giving it was a late hour, we decided to check out the hotel restaurant. Not quite sure what to expect, but expecting something mediocre at the very least.. we were pleasantly surprised to find our meal was top notch, and we were well attended to by our wonderful server Cesar. A visit to our table, and nice conversation with the Manager, Daniel, along with a complimentary glass of wine, and we were completely taken with this hotel restaurant & staff. If that wasn't enough, along came Eddie the hotel concierge, a sweet Italian man who charmed us and had us laughing and sharing stories... like an old friend walked into the room for a visit, He offered to drive us over to the Sheraton, pick us up after our meetings, and even offered to take us to the airport! The following day we checked out early for more meetings, and back at the hotel at rush hour to retrieve our luggage. Again, we opted to have dinner at the hotel restaurant and to do some follow up work, while we waited out the traffic. With out laptops in tow, we were again welcomed to use a table as we worked, and again had another amazing meal with the same wonderful service we had the evening before. I cannot say enough about the first rate old-fashioned customer service we received at this hotel restaurant. The rooms were accommodating, and clean, and adequate for what we needed during our stay. Our luggage was held after checkout in a secure area. The shuttle service was a nice bonus. Nearby Asian, Thai restaurants (try the Green Papaya) that were wonderful- just ask and you will be directed to a favorite. We felt very safe in this neighborhood, and did not hesitate to walk around. The price was reasonable, the parking at $19/day was exceptional, and we were very very pleased with our stay!
reviews.title: First Rate Customer Service

reviews.text: I stayed in a studio room (with a small kitchen). The room was spacious and clean. This was a pleasant surprise when compared to other NY hotels.
reviews.title: Friendly, modern, clean.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff were friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Central to a lot of things!

reviews.text: The hotel is a bit off the toursit trail but just 5 minutes walk from the subway (7 train) which takes you to mid-town Manhattan in around 30 minutes (express train) or 45 minutes on the regular stopping service.
reviews.title: Less money and easy to get to Manhattan
Great Hotel for going to US Tennis Open.
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed one night. We took the subway from Manhattan and the hotel is 4 blocks away from the last subway stop. The free transportation service provided to and from the US Open is very convenient! The hotel is very clean and the staff is very nice. We received complimentary breakfast because we booked directly with the hotel. We had a nice lunch in the restaurant with a complimentary glass of wine. We are planning to stay here next year for the US Open because we had a great time.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for one night while visiting the US Open. Parking was easy, and the room was clean, quiet and pleasant. The main reason we chose this hotel was for the free shuttle to the Open and they did not disappoint. We were taken there promptly and picked up when we were ready to leave . Will definitely book again if visiting next year.
reviews.title: Great for tennis fans

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Perhaps if this odd hotel weren't TA rated 1 in Flushing NY, I'd be less disappointed. They use old style floor-unit A/C that is 3 feet from the (sagging) bed. The unit rumbles loudly and blows on your back all night long. Place has a feel I can only call peculiar. Nearby dining options are spare unless you want authentic Asian cuisine--not as glamorous as it sounds. We stayed here one night for the US Open, but given they cater to that, they don't get the Tennis Channel in the room. The place seems clean and is okay but scarcely worth $300, and if it's No.1 rated, I can't imagine nos. 2 or 3.
reviews.title: Overrated. Ordinary in every way.

reviews.text: I was stuck in JFK at midnight of the Saturday of Labour Day weekend - NYC was crammed. I had stayed here about a month previously and had kept the phone number. When I rang the man on the desk remembered me and sorted me out with everything I needed; including complimentary late check out given my late arrival. The hotel is super clean, safe and quiet. The staff do all they can to assist. I would recommend this hotel without hesitation.
reviews.title: Saviours
Great hotel but a bit like Faulty Towers
reviews.text: Check in was an exercise in patience especially after an all day flight. Reception staff were extremely polite but were unable to complete a check in task without passing the buck to another staff member - they were trying to deal with too many customers at once - they need to prioritise and complete the task from start to finish.

The staff were all very helpful. Hotel shuttle was quick & informative. The hotel room was really nice and clean, we were informed that they the hotel itself was less than 5 years old. even though we were on the 8th floor we could still hear traffic off North Blvd. We had a corner room even with the double bed it was extremely spacious.
reviews.title: Nice hotel for the area & price

reviews.text: coffee in the room was ok nothing special. We were informed that if we booked thru the hotel, breakfast is included otherwise, any other discount online site customers would have to pay $10 pp for the breakfast.
reviews.title: A Pleasurable Experience

reviews.text: The shower was great it had a massage shower head. water pressure was excellent.
reviews.title: worst service and manager ever

reviews.text: overall, clean and convenient right near Flushing Chinatown. easy access to the subway. deli & shops are nearby. I would stay there again
reviews.title: Great hotel near subway right into Times Square
A great gem in the midst of downtown Flushing
reviews.text: We were recently visiting family in Queens New York and stayed at this hotel. Everyone on staff at this hotel was friendly and very helpful. The rooms were very clean and no bed bugs. It was centrally located, you could easily get into Manhatten and we were 3 miles from our family.

description: This 3 1/2 star Boutique Hotel, newly built in 2006, is centrally located in the heart of Queens. Known for its location to be a quick & easy commute to many local attractions, the Marco has quickly become a favorite for business travelers and leisure guests as well. Free shuttle to and from the LaGuardia Airport is available daily. Other transportation options include a complimentary area shuttle within 3 miles, as well as a complimentary shopping center shuttle (when available). The Marco is just 4 blocks away from the NY subway #7 train and the Long Island Rail Road's Flushing station. Both forms of public transportation will have guests in Manhattan in 30 minutes or less. Rooms: The Marco LaGuardia Hotel offers 81 guestrooms in a 8-story property. Each guestroom includes a refrigerator, microwave, a safe, brand new 36-inch flat screen TV that come with premium TV channels, first-run movies, and HBO. As well as a coffee/tea maker, 2 complimentary bottled waters, and air conditioning. Bathrooms include shower/tub combinations, hair dyers and designer toiletries. Guest rooms are business-friendly, equipped with complimentary wireless Internet access, well-lit spacious work desks, and direct-dial phones with speaker. Guestrooms also include clock radios. Some guestrooms have city views. Services include housekeeping and wake-up calls. Business Facilities: There is a 24-hour fully equipped Business Center. Meeting facilities measuring 2,700 sq ft include conference rooms, exhibit space, banquet facilities, and meeting rooms for small groups. The Marco LaGuardia Hotel also offers a fully equipped Fitness Center, a Bar/lounge, and a multilingual staff. Dining: The Marco LaGuardia Hotel also features a fantastic on-site restaurant, Magna Restaurant, offering a full bar and an impressive wine list. Conveniently open for breakfast, lunch, and dinner also available for in-room service. Guests enjoy a 10% discount.
